channel.title: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?
channel.description:
Hello. Tor is blocked in my country. I can only use two ways to connect to Tor: 1) `ISP -> obfs4 bridge > middle node > exit node > site` 2) `ISP -> VPN -> obfs4 bridge > middle node > exit node > site`
Which one should I prefer? Does VPN before Tor makes me safer or just slows down the connection?

item.title: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?
item.dc:creator: numeroustranslate
item.description:
anonhelp:

ISP → VPN → obfs4 bridge > middle node > exit node > site

ISP → VPN > middle node > exit node > site

Read full topic

item.title: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix – 2 Mar 22

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Read full topic
item.source: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?

item.title: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?
item.dc:creator: bestbefore2023
item.description:
Using a VPN to connect to Tor is rarely if ever advisable.
You are basically connecting to a permanent guard node which is a single point of failure.

It may obscure the fact that you are using Tor, but it would make your connection much less secure.

Read full topic
item.source: Any pros of using VPN before Tor?
